intro: Boerhavia pentandra, commonly known as redroot sandplum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces fleshy, reddish roots that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are typically pink or purple. Boerhavia pentandra thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
